The application perspective, the problem is that we are reaching a stage where health literacy and its limitations is actually causing a public health problem in the dissemination of information, and this is unfortunately unlikely to improve spontaneously in the near future and people were have been researching ways of improving the information dissemination, possibly by.

Recovering to new media amongst the most popular and widespread new media, obviously are all multimedia and interactive systems, and they have been very encouraging terms at developing serious games for a wide range of patient education aspects, including elderly patients.

And one of these objectives would be to be able in specific target applications to create such serious games so that patients, instead of having to read technical documents that, although simplified, remain quite challenging for the majority of them, would be able to use gaming techniques and simulation techniques to acquire the same knowledge and to some extent to rehearse.
The real world situations there would be faced with and acquired the relevant information and knowledge in a more constructive IST approach.

So the visualization you can now see more of the DNS system in action, so the patient will be visiting the hospital once he reaches the room where he will undergo surgery, the system shifts in third person mode.
Anna Patient sees himself undergoing surgery and then it can resume the visits or familiarize himself with the stations an ideally try to acquire knowledge.
By rehearsing the situation.

There are other important problems which are to do with because this is about learning the right behavior and we've also said before that these types of systems should allow the user to make mistakes and to learn from their mistakes.
That means that from the right behavior you also need to be able to generate undesirable behavior.
So you need to represent not just what is right, but also what is wrong in an explicit fashion, because that's the only thing that would.
Make you able to generate explanations.

So without getting into too many technical details here, the form of desirable behavior, whether the document guidelines documents are addressed to doctors or address to patients, is based on deontic structures, which are linguistic structures but also have an equivalent logical structures.
For instance, deontic logic is a model logic which is specialized with the inference over state of affairs, which are permitted or which are forbidden.

And there are rules of inference in these deontic logic that explained, sometimes in a very simple way, that if a state of affairs is compulsory, then of course it's forbidden that this state of affairs is not realized.
But semantically this also has limitation because the notion of the contrary of a state of affairs in the real world is a bit different from logic.
You can consider that the opposite of healthy eating.
Can be eating junk food but can also be not eating at all.
Both options are equally opposite an an we're not in a logical framework.
But these systems make it possible to.

Operates on the set of deontic operators to generate the opposite action to the recommended one and have a system operating on sequences such as the user being recommended as a desirable behavior to of course, to fast before blood test, but the system will be still offering the option to the user to have dinner and possibly not a very healthy dinner so that.

Not only that, is the desirable behavior represented, but also the undesirable one, and that would create different courses of actions where either the user would undergo the blood test or it will be bounced from the test room with the right explanation.
Hence learning on the spot what elements of the desirable behavior are.
So to conclude, it's important to understand that this is a different source of knowledge representation.
It's one which is designed to support interaction.
There are a lot of traditional AI problem which are framed in a quite different fashion.
Some of course have to do with the default knowledge representation and the overriding of default knowledge representation by the output of natural language processing, but others.

Have to do with with decisions of generating complementary knowledge, automatically generating wrongful behavior, and being able to integrate all that into a system in which you know causality is propagated during interaction.
Offering an environment where you can actually acquire knowledge by a trial and error.
Thank you for your attention.
